required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Study of Accelerated Radial Arterial Hemostasis
clinical_study.official_title: Utilizing a Novel Agent in a Randomized Study of Accelerated Radial Arterial Hemostasis Under Reduced Compression Following Percutaneous Transradial Coronary Angiography/Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical randomized study to evaluate the effect of using a hydrophobically modified polysaccharide (hm-P) bandage

detailed_description.textblock: The study will evaluate the clinical performance (e.g. hemostatic and patient outcomes) of this hm-P bandage by using an earlier time for removal of the bandage (e.g. 60 minutes) than the current standard of care (e.g. 90-180 minutes) while also reducing the inflated pressure of the band, and hence the compressive force put on the wrist of the patient, in increments of the % of inflation as per current protocol, with N=20 @ 100%, N=20 @ 75%, & N=20 @ 50%. This study will be completed while maintaining vascular integrity and patency through visualization in patients undergoing angiographic procedures via anticoagulated, percutaneous radial arterial cannulation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 60 patients, randomized into one of three arms

primary_outcome.description: Significant change in time to hemostasis
Change in the compressive force onto the access site

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the radial artery post hemostasis by visual or reverse Barbeau test

arm_group.description: 100% TR Band inflation relative to recommended inflation with 15-18 cc air injected in TR band bladder
75% TR Band inflation relative to recommended inflation with 11-14 cc air injected in TR band bladder
50% TR Band inflation relative to recommended inflation with 8-9 cc air injected in TR band bladder

intervention.description: hm-P bandage will be placed over the puncture site with the TR band positioned over the hemostatic bandage. The TR band will then be inflated per device specific instructions and to the group instructions. The arterial sheath will be removed from the body with slight device rotation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current patients who are undergoing diagnostic and interventional coronary/vascular angiography via a transradial approach with or without planned coronary or peripheral intervention.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
